channel.title: How can i make my server online
channel.description: :P :eek: :( :mad: :D ;) :) :rolleyes: :P :o :confused: :| ;D[sup][/sup] hi evryone can somoene help me whit getting my server online plz answer me ;D :confused: :confused: :confused: :confused:

item.title: How can i make my server online
item.dc:creator: @djspanke djspanke
item.description:
@djspanke wrote:

[quote=“Owner A Raffo, post:6, topic:272295”]you need to Portforward if uve already Portforward you need to click Run.batch
in the Run.batch file their should be a code like this if not then change it to this;

@echo off color 0a title RaffoScape.no-ip.biz, is now online :) java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

and if you want to compile your server use this code;

@echo RaffoScape Has Now Been Updated. if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2009, 11:28:37 am[/size][hr][quote author=Cuban0 Ftw link=topic=359257.msg2741321#msg2741321 date=1239381746]
Mitko, what does port forwarding have to do with anything of getting the server online?

Make sure your running your server when you try to connect.
[/quote]

And Portforwarding is so the people trying to connect to his server can connect if you didnt Portforward only the server owner would be able to get on using Localhost or 127.127.0.0.[/quote]

i know it’s not intentional but no advertising.

Read full topic
item.source: How can i make my server online

item.title: How can i make my server online
item.dc:creator: @Owner_A_Raffo Owner A Raffo
item.description:
@Owner_A_Raffo wrote:

you need to Portforward if uve already Portforward you need to click Run.batch
in the Run.batch file their should be a code like this if not then change it to this;

@echo off color 0a title RaffoScape.no-ip.biz, is now online :) java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

and if you want to compile your server use this code;

@echo RaffoScape Has Now Been Updated. if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2009, 11:28:37 am[/size][hr][quote=“Cuban0 Ftw, post:3, topic:272295”]Mitko, what does port forwarding have to do with anything of getting the server online?

Make sure your running your server when you try to connect.[/quote]

And Portforwarding is so the people trying to connect to his server can connect if you didnt Portforward only the server owner would be able to get on using Localhost or 127.127.0.0.

item.title: How can i make my server online
item.dc:creator: @Zahkoo Zahkoo
item.description:
@Zahkoo wrote:

1st. Go to Start-Run-Firewall.cpl
Turn off your firewall so people can first log in.

2nd. Get a no-ip from http://www.no-ip.com and then download the No-IP DUC once u get it downloaded open it up follow the instructions to finish that process. Then if it doesnt pop up go down to your toolbar and ur should have a ip sign with like a circle with slash over it, right click and then hit “show”

3rd. Run your server and right clickm with your no-ip DUC up on the screen by your server name and hit “update server” or “refresh”. Exit off your server running and then open it again.

4th. Your server should now be running! =]

Hope everything works out for you.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2009, 10:45:26 am[/size][hr]With wat I said rfom above You have to Portforward, you can look up many tutorials on this, and its not to hard. If your a real coder you should be able to do it! ^^

Read full topic
